page.title: 17Everleigh's Pheasants
page.content: The Pheasantry in Everleigh hatches a quarter of a million pheasant chicks per year. At 24hrs old the chicks are dispatched to land owners to enable their gamekeepers to rear them for the shoots. On a shoot there are approximately 10 beaters to 8 guns. Beaters use sticks as quietly as possible otherwise the birds crouch, or as Wiltshire men say "Jug Down" and will not move. Pheasants can only fly 100 yards at a time in straight flight and should only be shot flying away not on the approach. There are 7-8 drives per day, finishing one hour before sunset to enable the wiley birds to fly to roost. The beaters today receive a bottle of beer and Â£10 as payment.
